An amazing chapter in the Half-Life franchise.  Everything that makes the Half-Life series great is present here; great level design, fun combat, awesome set pieces, etc.  But, where the game really shines compared to the previous is story telling.  Half-Life has never been a series that has had complex characters (which worked for what the previous games were) but this game begins to touch on more of the big picture aspects of Half-Life's narrative, with Alyx, Eli, and surprisingly even the G-Man being the real stars of the show.

In short, this game is absolutely fantastic.  It's short and concise, while still offering up a meaty gameplay experience with fun shooting, great set pieces, and an engaging narrative that does a great job building off of the previous titles.

I bought this game with the Orange Box bundle, and I will never regret that decision. I am currently trying to get the Little Rocket Man achievement, and it just cracks me up whenever I look down and then the first thing that I see is Gnome Chompski's ridiculous smiling face.
This game and episode 1 are an experience. A good experience.
Донатная помойка.

[h1] Достойное продолжение предыдущего эпизода [/h1]

[h1] Сюжет вкратце [/h1]
В предыдущем эпизоде мы взорвали цитадель АЛЬЯНСА. Теперь на месте взрыва образовался супер-портал, который надо закрыть как можно скорее. 
Мы, то есть Гордон Фримен и Аликс Венс ищем путь к новой базе повстанцев.
По пути мы натыкаемся на новых врагов, в лице охотников, которые всячески хотят нас остановить. Один такой охотник смертельно ранил Аликс и мы вмсете с вортигонтами ищем лекарство для неё.
Во время ритуала-лечения нас снова навещает G-MAN и передает Аликс послание. 
Далее мы с Алекс едем в Белую Рощу, где находится база. Там мы встречаем старых друзей, в лице Доктора Кляйнера, Илая и доктор Арне Магнуссона. 
Наша задача - это защитить базу от АЛЬЯНСА, что бы запустить ракету в супер-портал. 
Все сопротивление помогает нам отбиватся, а доктор Магнуссон создал для нас оружие, для быстрого уничтожения страйдеров.
После отбитие атаки мы смотрим, как ракета влетела в супер-портал и закрыла его. 
Гордон и Аликс идут к вертолету. Но в друг, на нас нападают Советники Альянса, которые убили старика Илая, но нас спас Пес.

[h1] Стоит ли играть или нет? [/h1]
Это уже на ваше усмотрение.

[h1] Спасибо за внимание! [/h1]

[h1] Half Life 2: Episode Too Damn Good[/h1] 

The better half of the expansions, lots of new content, great setpieces, and a cliffhanger for the ages. What's not to love?

I was disappointed with the first Half Life 2 episode, but I can say here that that's not the case with this gem of a game.

Every stage of this game feels memorable for the right reasons, they're all distinct but share the common quality of just being plain fun. Whether I'm fighting off 3 red lights worth of antlions from all corners, navigating the toxic wastes to find a cool car, or even running in dimmed mine-shafts and caves away from it's guardian. And the grand finale with the striders made my heart race until the very end.

Unlike episode one, I can appreciate the changes made in episode two. The flashlight lasts much longer and only takes a second to recharge, and the change in scene from City 17 to lush forests was a much needed change in the series. The new hunter enemies makes a fierce entry into the series and while I enjoy them much more than the previous addition of zombine, my problem is that they're too many which can be a real drain on ammo (especially in the final level). Just remember to take them seriously or it could lead to unforeseen consequences. 

As for the story... without spoilers, it's pretty good, it's nothing crazy like I heard many people say it is but that's not to discredit it for how it invested me in Half-Life's world. And Valve does a lot of things to keep the player asking questions, of course we all know many of them wouldn't get answered until Epistle 3.

But overall, for it's 8$ price tag, I can easily recommend this game to anyone into Half Life 2.

Episode 2 did a lot to freshen up the gameplay while still focusing on expanding the story, and left players on one of the biggest cliffhangers in the game industry. From cinematic scripted sequences to intense antlion tower defense; from galvanizing Combine ambush to adrenaline-pumping strider invasion. The game offers a variety of new, thrilling challenges accompanied by a phenomenal soundtrack all the while retaining great storytelling at its core. This is easily a text-book example of what a great game looks like.

Edit: Currently replaying this game for achievement hunting and it has reminded me once again of what an absolutely stellar game Episode 2 is. The entire Half-Life franchise is phenomenal, of course, but Episode 2 is in my opinion the pinnacle of the Half-Life magic in terms of masterfully blending gameplay designs and storytelling elements into one cohesive mix.
